description.narrative:
Development of cycle-inclusive initiatives under the urban prosperity multidimensional approach and the New Urban Agenda guidelines, promoted by the United Nations. Specifically, a bicycle as a mean of transport strategy will be formulated and the final studies and designs for the first 20-kilometer Cycle-Infrastructure network will be developed.
The direct beneficiaries of the project will be the Municipality of Bucaramanga and the Metropolitan Area of Bucaramanga, whose are responsible for formulating public urban mobility policies in accordance with the City's Development Plan. The indirect beneficiaries will be approximately 500 thousand people who lives in the City of Bucaramanga.
The formulation of cycle-inclusive policies in Bucaramanga will contribute to the construction of a more equal and democratic city, understanding the bicycle as a tool to stimulate urban change towards a more sustainable territories. Likewise, the bicycle will be promoted as a mean of urban transport and will encourage the inclusion of cycling in the mobility plans of the city.
During the formulation of the cycle-inclusive policies, four (04) relevant thematic areas will be worked on: i) Infrastructure and services; ii) Citizen participation; iii) Regulatory aspects and regulation; and iv) Operation. Therefore, different dependencies of the local government, the Metropolitan Area of Bucaramanga and civil society organizations will be involved, in such a way that infrastructure and complementary services, information, participation, promotion strategies, regulatory policies, design guides, management, control and operation of the bicycle in urban mobility will be addressed. The official counterparts of the project will be the Mayor's Office of Bucaramanga and the Metropolitan Institution (AMB).

department.narrative: Regional Office for Latin America and Caribbean

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: 1. EA1: The municipality of Bucaramanga and its Metropolitan Area will count with planning instruments and action routes for cycling-inclusion within the city. The instruments are aligned with the Municipal Development Plan, Metropolitan Integral Development Plan, Master Mobility Plan, the Mobility Development Strategy and NUA’s Guidelines.
